newsitem.title: CROATIA: Levi Strauss extends licence in Croatia by 5 years.
newsitem.headline: Levi Strauss extends licence in Croatia by 5 years.

text.p: Croatia's largest textile firm Varteks Denim said on Tuesday U.S. clothing giant Levi Strauss & Co. had extended its manufacturing licence for another five years.

Levi's earlier threatened to withdraw the licence because of the firm's unresolved ownership structure but Varteks general manager Andjelko Herjavec replied the company would be fully privatised by May.
More than one half of the concern's basic capital -- some 300 million kuna (81 million marks) -- is still state-owned. The rest is owned by small shareholders.
"We have reached an agreement with Levi's for another five years," a company official told Reuters, adding it had not been signed yet. Varteks Denim's current licence expires on June 30.

Vartex Denim, now employing 550 workers, has operated profitably since 1983 when it first signed a contract to produce Levi's jeans. Its prosperity has helped maintain other, less lucrative Vartex plants.
The company has a licence to produce all Levi's products except its exclusive '501' jeans. -- Zoran Radosavljevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
